website_summaries.verdict: You'll pay a lot for the Asus RT-AC88U, but it has everything you'd want in a router. If you have the money, this is the router to get.
pros: The Asus RT-AC88U router has eight superfast Gigabit LAN ports, speedy Wi-Fi performance and lots of useful features
Its Web interface is smartly designed and easy to use
cons: The router's USB 3.0 port is awkwardly placed, and when coupled with an external hard drive, its NAS performance is just average

website_summaries.verdict: The Asus RT-AC88U is a pricey dual-band router that is packed with features. It supports MU-MIMO technology and delivered solid 5GHz throughput in our tests.
pros: Loaded with ports and management features
Multi-User Multiple Input, Multiple Output (MU-MIMO) enabled

customer_reviews.title: The AC68U does about 35-40mb at best, the AC86U will max out my connection with ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an AC68U knowing it would give vastly improved VPN performance on my 200mb connection. The AC68U does about 35-40mb at best, the AC86U will max out my connection with room to spare as the processor is much better at handling VPN's AES encryption. I use Merlin firmware on it so I can set specific devices to use the VPN while leaving others to bypass it (for things like Netflix). Can't fault it.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and unstable
customer_reviews.text: router has become unstable and unreliable, have upgraded to recent asus firmware and also merlin to try to help, however it is still unreliable. I have experienced 4 CPU 100 percent hard reset required issues today alone, freeze/hangs on wireless and wired connections. Shame, router has great feature set however I need it to be reliable which it is not. Sadly its being returned today, at this cost it really should be better.
customer_reviews.author: Baron Vlad

customer_reviews.title: Nice product but I still have to use an extender :0(
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to replace the WiFi on my Virgin Hub 3. Setup was easy, the user interface on the app is excellent and the WiFi is definitely more stable. However I was really surprised that I still had to go out a buy a WiFi extender to pick up the WiFi signal only 6-7 meters away from the router. It's a big investment paying for a new router and still having spend for an extender. To be fair Asus make the same outlandish performance claims as every other manufacturer out there. Interestingly Asus don't even make a UK version WiFi extender that supports this model, I had to buy TP Link
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very fast and reliable router.
customer_reviews.text: I recently upgraded to the Virgin super hub 3.0, and to be honest, the WiFi on it is terrible. I decided to buy this router to replace the Hubs WiFi, and it was very easy to set up. I have never had faster internet speed before, even over WiFi, I've reached speeds of almost 400Mbps. This product is definitely worth the £200 price tag. The software is easy to use and you can do everything you need to with it, it even comes with its own protection, which does have a slight performance impact on the 2.4GHz network, but not the 5GHz. Overall I highly recommend this router if you want an extremely fast internet connection for all your devices.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great router, more mbs , faster games , five stars !!!
customer_reviews.text: Great router, I have virgin media 350mb package & with this router I get 480mb , games just seem to work better along with other Xbox functions, streaming works better, the app & router is great with lots of different options, cannot recommend highly enough. It is an expensive product but if your a gamer it’s well worth it
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Was good before the update
customer_reviews.text: Started off great with significantly faster speeds compared to my standard issued virgin media hub. After three months of use the 2ghz band won't turn on. I've done numerous resets, firmware is on the latest version etc. It's only after I looked this issue up online do I now see that it's a common issue with this model and the newer firmware they are running. I've even rolled back to previous versions of the firmware but the 2ghz will not work
customer_reviews.author: Damien Stenson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible device, unfit for purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute trash of a device. Been running for a few months and devices constantly get disconnected or cannot communicate with other devices on the network or internet. Wifi signal is bad from it, even within a few meters of the device. Firmware does not report connected devices and regularly needs to be rebooted. I've turn off the wifi on it now and just use it as an AIMESH controller. The small satellite wifi units I got are a million times better at giving a good signal and devices do not get connection issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. John E. Sewell

customer_reviews.title: My life got a lot better
customer_reviews.text: It's been about 15 years since i really paid any attention to routers, since my broadband provider (VirginMedia) have been supplying "all in one" modems and routers. Investigating a video buffering issue I discovered my SuperHub 3 probably wouldn't work with the Ring Doorbell/Cameras I am planning to get, so I bought this router. It is superb. Setup was easy, the gui is intuitive, and it is full of features that I never knew I'd be interested in - signal strength of each connected device, traffic analysis, etc. Plenty of options for guest networks, restricting device access to certain hours, etc. It has also noticeably improved my NAS, Sonos and FireTV connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: A. Swanson

customer_reviews.title: There is a known fault with this product and ASUS will not RMA under warranty
customer_reviews.text: Basically, within 1-3 days, the Wifi speed will drop to about 2-20mbps top download speed with a massive lag of about 140ms and anything using ethernet, is still running at 100% download speed (in my case that 400mbps). I have to reboot router every time to fix issue. This is a known falt and forum riddle with customer complaints and yet ASUS response, reboot is the fix - that how routers works. No its not! I never had issue like this before but I only had issue once I connected about 8 wifi devices (phones, tablets, smart bulbs etc) to router - so the router seems to be only able to handle about 3-5 wifi devices.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Gary Scott

customer_reviews.title: Lots of 2.4Ghz wireless drop outs
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product a few months and while it has lots of options and a good interface, this all counts for nothing if it cannot deliver stable wifi. In my case, this router drops the 2.4ghz every few days. This means all my smarthome devices stop working and the only resolution is a reboot of the router. There are others experiencing similar problems with this model, but theres seems to be no resolution from the manufacturer
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Performance and Connection Issues
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a Netgear router I had been using for around three years. The reason being I wanted a better gaming performance. The routers user interface is pretty good but the wifi range is hopeless compared with the Netgear router. I also had a major problem with the wifi connection of an Epson printer although the signal was good at the printer it kept giving a connection error message. I referred to the technical forums and it appeared there was issue with this particular printer. I wasted a lot of time trying to resolve these issues and finally gave up and returned the item.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router - highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent router. I'm a VM customer and wanted to use my own router instead of their rubbish SH3. I've always had problems with Virgin SuperHubs. The 2 would need a reboot every few days to work correctly and the 3 is unbelievably restrictive with silly requirements for WiFi passwords. This device is superb! It's nice and small (without the aerials) and doesn't take much space. The UI is extremely intuitive and the WiFi coverage is brilliant! Can't fault it.. I've only had to reboot it once in 3 months!
customer_reviews.author: M. Moghal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The best router I have ever bought, and I have bought way too many routers. Running the Merlin firmware, it does everything I could possibly want and it's a joy to configure; it literally is decades ahead of my last router, which was a Netgear Nighthawk X4S which cost £270, only 8 months ago. The admin interface of the netgear looks like a website from the mid 90's, and had a minimal feature set. This router may have a really high price, but regardless of what you want to do, this router will handle it.
customer_reviews.author: Whatever

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Router
customer_reviews.text: Had this router for just over a month now. It is performing brilliantly and has surpassed my expectations in every area. The range is excellent and the data transfer speed is without compromise. The router was really simple to set up and work brilliantly with my Virgin 350 service. Prior to this router I had a Netgear R8000 which was absolutely garbage in comparison to this Asus router. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable. Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: Simply unreliable. I'm on my 3rd one in less than 3 years. While they work, they're great (with Merlin fw) but they just don't last. Before this I had an RT-AC87U which failed within 2 years, and the replacement failed in less than one. I'm not usually somebody who writes off a manufacturer after one or two bad units but 5 faulty routers from Asus in as many years just isn't good enough, especially for what they cost.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Got two of these in a mesh network to cover our 3-story house
customer_reviews.text: Liking these routers for their simplicity in setup and their overall performance. I'm coming from a VirginMedia Super Hub 3 setup, so anything is better than that I suspect, but with the super hub in modem-mode and a pair of these within relatively close line of sight of each other, we cover the whole house and garden with a strong wifi signal, even with brick internal walls in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Clitherow

customer_reviews.title: ASUS RT AC86U Excellent solid performance
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to a fibre 200Mb connection with Virgin Media. After ongoing wifi issues with the supplied Hub 3, I decided to buy this and put the hub 3 in modem mode. Since using the ASUS to route my wifi, we now have excellent solid signal all around the house with no drops in speed or drop outs. Can't rate it highly enough. It's a little expensive but it's been worth every penny to provide us with the speeds we are actually paying for. Big thumbs up from here
customer_reviews.author: MR N HANDLEY

customer_reviews.title: The best router at the best price.
customer_reviews.text: The fastest router for gaming..I bought another Asus product because my RT-AC68U is still working like the first day but I gave this router to my parents. Now with the AC86 the result is the same or better, I use the router with the DSL PlusNet Router (PlusNet Router only provides the Internet) and the management of the rest is work for the Asus. This router could be better than the AC88 due to his CPU Dual Core at 1.8Ghz is faster than the CPU of the Asus AC88. If you want the best connection by cable or Wifi buy this router.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben

customer_reviews.title: Nice features, let down by constant WiFi drops...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this mid last year (2019). Initial setup is simple. Nice advanced options as well. Shame it's quality isn't as plentiful as the features it offers. WiFi dropouts are constant with this router. It's highly irritating and infuriating at a point. Firmware updates, factory resets, power cycle... nothing fixes. If you're cabling everything to it, then it's fine... but be realistic, that's not going to happen. Poor product which is a disappointment for ASUS. Go for a different model. Stay clear of this.
customer_reviews.author: Cm

customer_reviews.title: 2.5 GHz malfunctioned and all IoT devices failed, apparently is a very common problem
customer_reviews.text: We attached this router to our vodafone. Took a lot of time to configure with PPoE settings even after getting the credentials from Vodafone. Didn't work in the end so used it as an extender (which worked in less than 5 seconds). I searched for 4-5 hours on internet on how to fix the router for 2.5 GHz issue. The device doesn't seem to broadcast the range at all! After that called the technical support team and they said it is a device issue. Internet forums is full of similar complaints. What a disappointment after paying such a hefty price.
customer_reviews.author: Vebz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome router
customer_reviews.text: Had issues with the previous router (Linksys velop mesh system which is simply the worst router I've ever owned). This one is great, provides a very strong 2.4 signal in a 3 story house, 5ghz works really fast but obviously the range is not great. My favourite part of this router is that it gives you lots of control using the great UI that comes with it, and there are several open source firmware solutions you can use with it if you need to do something more advanced. Been using it for several months and not had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Klogd

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: This router is amazing and the control you get over the networks is really high quality and amazing to be honest, I chose this router for my Virgin Media router because VM routers are really bad and give you no control at all, not counting the security flaws and crappy Wi-Fi, but asus deffenetly came and saved the day, for a standard house hold this router is amazing, if you have a bigger home I would reccomend buying ASUS RT-AC5300 AiMesh Tri-band to cover the entire house, or you can always go AI mesh if you want with multiple asus routers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a dead spider
customer_reviews.text: Most people upgrade their devices when they approach end of life or they are not functioning how they once did. Not me! I needed more range for pooping while playing Farmville.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace my aging RT-N66U. Easy to setup, asus UI one of the better ones I've tried. WiFi performance excellent and reaches every room, N66U didn't. Installed merlin firmware and running VPN client. Have it setup with custom rules so only traffic to specified devices goes through tunnel. No CPU bottle neck. Getting VPNs max speed using open vpn protocol. Wish I'd upgraded sooner.
customer_reviews.author: callum

customer_reviews.title: A disaster. A let-down. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: Haing other ASUS wifi routers, I thought I'd "step up" and get this beastie. What a mistake. Returned it within 2 weeks as it kept crashing (just stopping working), the WIFI would drop every few minutes, the unit got VERY hot - so much so, the cables plugged in to it were all limp and floppy. May have been just a faulty unit, but also quite possible ASUS just went O.T.T. here and should maybe have had a fan in it or something. Replaced with an RT-AC86U that's been fantastic and seems no less-performant WIFI in real use.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. I. Jeffray

customer_reviews.title: Great performance
customer_reviews.text: Great router! I was struggling with coverage in my house and tried a few other high end routers before finding this one. Works brilliantly, lots of features and no need to reboot regularly like previous routers. I tried the Netgear R8000 and the Linksys WRT3200 ACM- this one wipes the floor with both for performance and reliability. I had DD-WRT running on the linksys router and that was good for a few days but progressively got unreliable. This router is a bit more pricey than the other 2 but it is worth it
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Using this with virgin super hub 3 and the diffeeence between using this and the router on the super hub is night and day. One you put the router in a nice central place that's out off the way, mine is on top of a shelving unit, the range and let of this thing are amazing. My pc which is at the far side of my flat has seen its WiFi speeds go from 20mbs to 160mbs. Everything else has connected smoothly and it was easy to set up. Also the amount of things you can do with the app is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Rob P

customer_reviews.title: Best router I have used !
customer_reviews.text: I changed from SKY to Virgin last week and never thought about routers but the Virgin router was pretty bad. I Googled and watched YouTube as to what to do, I took advice after reading all the positive comments about this Asus Router on Amazon and I am so pleased I did, I have used many different makes of router but can honesty state this is the best, great interface, lots of options and a very strong WiFi signal throughout the house + 3 year warranty. Just had to put Virgin modem/router in modem mode only then connecting and set up is a breeze. Truly impressed !
customer_reviews.author: PeterC

customer_reviews.title: Better than standard router supplied by supplier
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a BT Homehub 2 as my wifi speeds were very low although signal strength was strong. Immediately after installation, my wifi speeds were improved by approx 100Mbps which is great, note everyone would not see this improvement. Range is very good and the user interface is great, you can monitor what is using the most data and turn devices on / off. Would 100% recommend this as a good upgrade for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great speeds, became unreliable quickly
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up initially but over a couple of weeks the router would reset itself and speeds would drop considerably. Also had problems linking in a wifi extender as it didn't reach the upstairs properly. When it worked it was great speeds but unreliable so returned and went for the Netgear 8000 nighthawk which is so much easier to manage via the interface and more stable. Worth mentioning that I am not very technical and this is a technical piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: Maffa

customer_reviews.title: Too much power and waste for average internet connection.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with the Virgin Media Hub3 to boost the wifi. It's a great router with signal being very strong. The range only improved maybe 4ft compared to the Virgin Media Hub. But this Asus is made for gamers and someone with 500mbs or 1GB connection. Most phone or laptop cant even make use of the power of this router. If this was placed middle of the house then this is a great router but my connection is front of the house. I have moved to a mid range Mesh instead.
customer_reviews.author: Misbah K.

customer_reviews.title: Best wifi coverage ever!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been struggling along with a Virgin media hub3. It wasn’t able to keep up with all the devices in the house and wifi was not really covering the house. I solved this with this ASUS router. Set up was really easy and the wifi hasn’t skipped a beat. The app is simple and easy to use. You can leave it to do it’s thing or delve in to its many features. 100% recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Forsyth

customer_reviews.title: It works well and fast!
customer_reviews.text: Like the easy set up. Strong and fast WiFi signals. Several guest SSID’s. Good user interface and VPN set up. The game fast thing...... only for certain games and it is a subscription service. Although it seems good and it may not be relevant for me personally. I suppose that’s not a negative but be aware it is a subscription if you want the gamer fast thing. Overall I am very happy with it after a reluctant replacement for my Cisco router which was getting slower. The replacement ASUS has put the speed back up to where it should be and has a stronger signal. Bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Alexa and IFTTT, despite what Asus advertise
customer_reviews.text: While it doesn't mention it in the Amazon description, Asus advertsie this product as being compatible with Alexa and IFTTT. It's not. Asus haven't released the Alexa channel in the UK. And any attempt to link with IFTTT fails; I've seen a variety of different error messages, and contacted Asus support, but with no success. Other than this, the router's fine, but nothing special. Speed is ok. Reception isn't great - it's in the middle of the house, but we still have black spots. Firmware is a bit buggy and can be rather overwhelming, but has been improved since I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: N. Cumpstey

customer_reviews.title: Known issue for connections.
customer_reviews.text: Setup and range are brilliant, as they should be but within a week realised while playing online that I kept being disconnected and reconnected. Like every 5-10 mins annoying to say the least. Then noticed my phone doing it then the xbox etc; I did a speedtest all ok, and a ping test through cmd all ok. I then did a search for this issue and found other people with the same issue and that Asus know about it from the start but haven't bothered to, or can't change it in any updates. Really disappointed as the range and speed was awesome, back to the old sky box.
customer_reviews.author: delta94

customer_reviews.title: Router cpu usage is too high when streaming media through connected harddisk
customer_reviews.text: This product looks good & stylish but please be aware it is big as well..range is awesome and no complaint about it but i sent it back and also deducted one star as i want to connect my harddisk with it and stream media to my home network..i upgraded to asus rog 5300 for the same reason but it also suffers From same problem even advertisement says it got quad core processor so it looks its a firmware issue .. recommended for people who want good coverage but doesnot want to use harddisk with it
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C. K. GURUNG

customer_reviews.title: Not recommending to anyone.
customer_reviews.text: Tech support is completely hopeless, not easy to setup as booklet doesn’t show any step by step configuration how to fully setup, disappointed with ASUS support, tried to setup and register online device and not accepting device Serial number. Not happy with the support as can’t contact by email as asking to enter device serial number and it’s not accepting, very disappointed with ASUS online customers service .
customer_reviews.author: Mayur Gandhi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up but 2.4ghz wifi did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: The setup procedure was really easy but I could only get the 5ghz signal to work. The 2.4ghz did not work for me. I didn’t use the tech support so I can’t comment on that. It was bought as a wifi router for virgin in modern mode. It was easy to switch the hub 3.0 into modern only mode. I also ordered the tp link ax50 as well. This was also easy to setup and works well so I kept that one.
customer_reviews.author: Rees family

customer_reviews.title: ... primarily bought this router as my existing one was pretty old. I was hoping to get a range ...
customer_reviews.text: I primarily bought this router as my existing one was pretty old. I was hoping to get a range increase so that I can get connections in my garden. Unfortunately the range was no better than my old one. Despite this, I am seeing my speeds double in the house, so there is a significant change. It is a large router, so be sure that you have a suitable location for it. Setting it up was easy. It took me 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Turkish

customer_reviews.title: Full speed ahead!
customer_reviews.text: The plus side is that this is an amazing piece of kit! The only downside is that the improved internet means it’s easier and quicker for my family to spend my money!! Internet with Virgin, constantly bad connection problems, signal dropping and couldn’t access any.....proper internet sites This was easy to set up and fixed all our internet issues!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. Redworth

customer_reviews.title: Asus RT-AC86U
customer_reviews.text: We have a Virgin hub 3, it constantly drops the signal even when there is just one device connected to it. It has driven us to despair. Eventually we did what so many others have done by switching it to modem only and attaching a router eg the Asus RT-AC86U. Our problems have been solved. The signal has not dropped once, no more timer spinning around and around on our tablets/phones/PCs. Really pleased with this piece of kit. It was so easy to set up and provides excellent coverage of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Yan

customer_reviews.title: Asus RT AC86u.  WiFi issues
customer_reviews.text: Asus RT Ac 86u ..I purchased this to replace my trusty RT AC87u, as I am considering a mesh setup. After two weeks I have returned it due to the wifi constantly dropping out. Very disappointed, I have now reinstated the 87u, so glad I didn't sell it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: And there's the internet speed I pay for...
customer_reviews.text: I seldom do reviews but credit where credit is due, I love this router! If it could of hopped out of the box and plugged itself in I think that it would of. Setup was shockingly easy and my home now receives wifi everywhere. Goodbye TP link boosters! Worth the investment so far! Maybe 5 stars is a little too kind but when you compare it to the virgin superhub it's hard not to think Asus providing the 2nd coming of christ... The supporting phone apps aren't​ amazing or anything but the router does it's main job tremendously well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup, improved coverage and speed instantly.
customer_reviews.text: Was set up and ready to go within 30 minutes. It has made a huge difference to WiFi coverage and speed. I was using the not standard ISP router up to this and finnaly decided to take the plunge on this router and don't think I'll be looking back. Only bad point but this more an Amazon issue is the price I pain was 5GBP more than advertised, dispute ongoing. Early days with the router but can't fault it.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Duggan

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for Virgin Hub 3.0 customers.
customer_reviews.text: Added this to my Virgin Hub 3.0 using the virgin hub as a router only and the WiFi coverage is so much better. The parental feature works a treat too. Had this installed for a month now and not had one issue unlike the unreliable Netgear Nighthawk it replaced (5g network stopped working).
customer_reviews.author: Mr S R Webb

customer_reviews.title: Good signal & range
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Asus Zen mesh wi-fi router with this device and it is far better in terms of stability of connection and strangely, range. The zen system was constantly dropping signal and didn't play well with Bluetooth devices, not so this one. If I wanted, i could mesh this device up with another that supports the Asus mesh system, but with this single router, i don't need to.
customer_reviews.author: Fizban

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've had an Asus RT-N66U for the last decade and it never let me down until it suddenly gave up the ghost. It's been so reliable that another device from Asus was really the only option for me. Setup was easy but I installed Merlin on it straight away to get the additional feature that that firmware offers. Hopefully it will be a reliable as my old router was and will give me another decade of use.
customer_reviews.author: A Riley

customer_reviews.title: Equipment for the serious user
customer_reviews.text: What a beast, if you're internet speed is good you will get maximum use out of this product. I use it with a 1GB connection speed internet and it has been outstanding in performance. It's relatively easy to set up and has all kind of useful features if you really want to get into it. Wifi range seems huge but I don't know the extents. I have it wired directly to my laptop and have regular speeds up to 930mb !
customer_reviews.author: Amie-May

customer_reviews.title: Best wifi router for the money
customer_reviews.text: if you have a medium size house don't bother with nest systems get a decent router like this and you will be sorted. Previously I was getting 20mbps on the top floor of my house using the virgin media home hub 3.0 (350mbps connection). I'm now getting 250mbps+ on the top floor and full whack everywhere else. Added security features are great too. A worthwhile investment.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Pownall

customer_reviews.title: A huge step up from Superhub 3.
customer_reviews.text: Broadband is expensive. Especially if you’re paying a premium for the fastest available internet. So, do yourself a favour and bung the trash router that your ISP has given you into modem mode and get a better router, like this one! A significant improvement from Virgin’s “super”hub 3. WiFi signal is much better. Adaptive QoS is fantastic. Good user interface both from app and web browser.
customer_reviews.author: PedallingSquares

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Router.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to set up the AI mesh with my my current AC5300 to give complete coverage in the house and to connect to a few things outdoors. So easy to set up and once done have full coverage indoors and outdoors at great speeds. No dropouts anywhere and system seems to be so much faster as no constant trying reconnects for outdoor items.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz

customer_reviews.title: 0 super hub. Have been absolutely delighted - places where ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I was having problems getting a wifi signal to all parts of my house with the Virgin 3.0 super hub. Have been absolutely delighted - places where I was getting no connection at all now get a strong connection and the internet speed test app I am using on my iphone6 is showing internet connection of 150mb. Close up it is giving similar to my wired connection of 200mb per second. My wife thinks it looks like a Klingon Bird of Prey sitting on he cabinet next to the tv - but as she is a Trekkie that is intended as a compliment.
customer_reviews.author: K S.

customer_reviews.title: Really inadequate performance.
customer_reviews.text: Really inadequate performance. I don't know if this particular one is faulty or what but I have had this for a year and had constant WiFi problems. Now I have gone with Ubiquiti UniFi, I am absolutely surprised at what amazing speeds I get with it. Even when I have both running on the same SSID, devices right next to the ASUS choose to connect to UniFi instead, even tho its around 10 meters further away...
customer_reviews.author: Narek V.

customer_reviews.title: good wireless router
customer_reviews.text: Really like this router. Easy to set up and configure. The on board protection works well. Wi-fi signal strength increased around 10% on average according to my wi-fi network tester so better than the Wireless router supplied by my ISP that I now have setup in modem mode.
customer_reviews.author: Genasisgod

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router to use with a Virgin Media Super Hub. I was having problems with the Super Hub for a long time as it was disconnecting a lot and couldn't cope with multiple devices being connected through Wi-Fi at the same time. I am very satisfied with this router. The wi-fi network is now much more stable. I haven't seen a massive difference in wireless speeds but the signal is stronger on each device. Router was very easy to set up and took me less than 5 minutes to get up and running.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Just the ticket
customer_reviews.text: Delivered ahead of planned date, very easy to set up and use, boosted my WiFi signal considerably compared to my Virgin homehub that it replaced. I used to have issues dropping signal in some parts of the house, but no longer. The ability to set up guest networks is very welcome, meaning I can give visitors a separate WiFi code and not risk exposing my home network to unknown devices.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Virgin Superhub 3. The perfect solution to poor performance.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to overcome the performance issues on a Virgin Superhub 3. Easy to set up, wifi performance has exceeded expectations, not sure how i have put up with the Virgin hub for so long, this is my best purchase this year. Kids PS4 no longer lagging, 200 mbps on wifi upstairs, where we struggled to get 40 mbps. Highly recommended if you are struggling on Virgin wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great router for busy wifi areas
customer_reviews.text: I live in an apartment complex with a very overcrowded wifi space so even with this one the 2.4ghz speeds aren't great, however the 5ghz i get easily the full 240Mbps download speed everywhere in my 2 story apartment. The user interface feels a bit dated, but still easy to understand and navigate. I love the fact that it comes with a lifetime subscription to TrendMicro security which checks for all types of malware etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement to Wi-Fi signal
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product. It has drastically improved the wi-fi signal strength we're getting in every room and replaces the router functionality in our Virgin Media superhub. Only wish we could completely get rid of the VM superhub and replace the internet connection it provides with a quality modem...
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: YES!!!
customer_reviews.text: This router was what I was looking for my apartment. It has an excellent range, was easy to set-up (for those using Virgin Media, just use your box as a bridge), and together with my Asus AC68 on my desktop, I reduced latency and the signal is in full strength the entire time.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Gonçalves Machado

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Decided to upgrade my router and after a little debate choose this. It was so simple to setup as I just transferred all my cables across and ran through the setup wizard. The software is simple to use and I like the more detailed information that you can see compared to my older router. The range of this router is a little bit better than my previous one although not by a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, but maybe I got a lemon?
customer_reviews.text: It seems I got a lemon, the 2.4 radio is just not doing much. I got a return approval from ASUS. Also, the Aimesh setup was pretty unstable. I spent countless hours talking to support and sending them many emails with logs until they just gave up after I had to analyze what was going on and tell them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great speed and easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: I've got a gigabit symmetrical line but the router supplied wasn't up to much so got this as an upgrade. It's extremely easy to setup and the performance has been exceptional. I also setup openvpn which took all of about 3 minutes. VPN runs very well with minimal overhead. I get around 700Mbps DL consistently over WiFi, with two walls between me and the router, which you will struggle to beat without a WiFi 6 router.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Reliability issues
customer_reviews.text: I really like the Asus software, the 8 ports was good, and the Asus Merlin packages add some good features. However this is the second Asus router, and each has had problems with the 2.4 GHz radio where it just stops working after a period of time. Rebooting the router does not always bring it back. Both have been, sadly, returned and now looking at getting a different brand and chipset.
customer_reviews.author: A. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: WiFi from down the road.
customer_reviews.text: Had to upgrade an aging router with disconnection issues; was expecting this to be a good option, but when walking to the local shop and still being connected to my home WiFi... I was pretty impressed. Easy to set up and use; features are brilliant (especially for parents wishing to control internet access times etc, or gamers wanting to streamline their applications). Perfect for large houses or ones with awkward dead zones with lesser routers.
customer_reviews.author: Angus M

customer_reviews.title: A pain to get going
customer_reviews.text: After many hours was spent trying to set this up, eventually it worked and it was not a wasted effort. It's a significant upgrade over my previous ASUS router giving me a better signal in my upstairs rooms, the addition of having 2.4 GHz built into the same SSID as 5 GHz was a welcome addition over a previous model. The stability has been great and I haven't had to touch it since originally setting it up.
customer_reviews.author: Callum Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Avoid - Get the new generation without ugly antennas
customer_reviews.text: Avoid. This is my 3rd Asus router, and by far - this is the worst. I bought this after reading the review on cnet.com. I really needed a router with good range and capable of handling 20 or more wireless devices. Worst decision ever. Having to restart the router every morning was the straw that broke the camels back. Wish i had done a more thorough research by taking into account, the many user reviews on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Did wonder what I had bought as box was big and heavy but the weight is mainly the great quality box
customer_reviews.text: WOW what a difference it made. Connected to Virgin Superhub in modem mode and now have 5 bars of fast signal everywhere in the house!!! Connection was a breeze. Switched off everything, plugged all ethernet cables in ASUS and connected it to WAN port of VM in modem mode now and powered back on. On opening a browser window i was presented with a set up screen and boom , all done! Did wonder what I had bought as box was big and heavy but the weight is mainly the great quality box! All devices connected automatically even my troublesome NAS
customer_reviews.author: mikeinlondon

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and brilliant signal
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace my virgin superhub (crap wifi). Still need to use the hub in modem mode then connect to router through ethernet. Easy to setup and I now get excellent signal and speed throughout the house.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: brilliant router
customer_reviews.text: this is the only routet which accuratly works out your internet from the cable thats been plugged in , you barely need to know any info as it sorts itself out , another thing is if your with karoo it will recognise it very well also its a good quality fast router as well , highly recommended if you have dsl there is a fibre version but i think this model lso have a fibre connection as well
customer_reviews.author: jo

customer_reviews.title: YOU still need a modem
customer_reviews.text: I cant comment on the quality of the product as I thought i was getting a replacement to my BT home hub. Turns out you still need a modem to connect so I sent it back. Maybe I should have read in more detail so hopefully you wont make the same mistake if thats what you are expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M. Davies

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea, shoddy execution
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a capable router with good wifi coverage and speed, in addition I wanted one which could terminate VPN connections, handle DDNS updates and provide QoS features for my rather poor broadband link. The UI on this is good and easy to use, had the router functioned properly it would have been ideal, sadly I had to return it as the QoS feature made no noticeable difference but also I was only able to achieve about 12 MB/s transfer rate through the gigabit ports, running the same connections via a separate switch resulted in ~80MB/s. Unfortunately it seems whilst the feature set was there the build quality was not.
customer_reviews.author: S. DAVIES

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, if you have poor virgin wifi, buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to try and sort my lame wifi from virgin medias superhub 3, despite what virgin say their router is rubbish. After endless problems not being able to watch any streamed content without constant freezing, buffering or drop outs (well over 200mb speed, still lame), I started using this and its awesome - not one issue since I boughtbit (a fair while now) even streaming 4k on a 100mb connection. Lots of features and easy set up, usual Asus build quality. Great.
customer_reviews.author: M. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: broken 2.4ghz
customer_reviews.text: if you have any legacy 2.4ghz devices then don't buy any of the latest Asus routers, after a couple of days the 802.11g broke - the network is visiible but nothing can connect. Confirmed problem on small net builder website
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Rowe

customer_reviews.title: This one just is great! Coverage is better than my previous Asus 56
customer_reviews.text: I have used Asus and Netgear routers in the past. This one just is great! Coverage is better than my previous Asus 56. So easy to set up and with switches, connects all my Hi-Fi, Sky Q, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Wizzard

customer_reviews.title: Bought the AC86U to replace a WRT1900ACS v1 and wouldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought the AC86U to replace a WRT1900ACS v1 and wouldn't say it adds anything performance wise ie range or speed to which i was getting with my 1900ACS plus sharing files from NAS are about the same speed PS using with a Draytek modem ADSL Update March 2019 it died the other day and wouldn't turn on so sent back
customer_reviews.author: Eyerex

customer_reviews.title: Gaming Wifi
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a great bit of kit but the lack of instructions with it & the very confusing website with yet again no instructions make this very very hard work for any novice to try to set up... I mean FFS include a set up guide & basic instructions in the box when someone is paying this much for a router.
customer_reviews.author: Voodooist

customer_reviews.title: If upgrading from super hub, you’ll love it!
customer_reviews.text: Oh boy, this router is amazing. Our household has a lot of devices and the Virgin super hub 3 was not up to the job. This has now boosted every bodies Wi-fi speed, can handle all the connections you throw at it and has a fantastic phone app to manage everything you need including firmware updates. A serious bit of kit and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: As expected - Faulty 2.4GHz Wifi on ARRIVAL! (Faulty Day 1)
customer_reviews.text: All great until after few hours 2.4GHz become unresponsive! Nothing helped - different firmware nor settings.. Why Asus does that??????????? Whats the agenda? Annoy most of their customers??? SHAME as I was getting full 200Mb over OpenVPN 256bits.... Returned - refunded and said sorry to my trusty R7000 (works ok last 10 years....)
customer_reviews.author: Tomas

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy for better wifi coverage
customer_reviews.text: Great router if you dont have blackspots in your home. Interface is very customizable and easy to navigate. The wifi signal is no improvement on a standard BT Home Hub which is what i was trying to improve upon. I would have returned this if I found this out in time but unfortunately not and now im stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant. Highly advise getting ASUS over any other routers
customer_reviews.text: Love this router! Amazing range that switches from 5GHz to 2.4GHz when I’m back garden. Still get an amazing signal. Make sure it is on smart connect to have that feature. Had other routers such as TPLINK and Netgear and would never recommend them. ASUS all the way if you want a stable and reliable connection. AiMesh is also great if you have another ASUS router.
customer_reviews.author: theystraysheep94

customer_reviews.title: Great WiFi coverage
customer_reviews.text: WiFi coverage has improved much more than the Virgin Media Hub 3, Still not great from the other side of the house but that is because of distance. Love the guest WiFi profiles as stops guests from joining private networks.
customer_reviews.author: Deepal

customer_reviews.title: VIRGIN HUB 3 BOOSTER!
customer_reviews.text: Gives much better range. Using with a Virgin Super Hub 3. Just drop the Hub into Modem mode (via the settings) and wait for it’s front light to go red/purple/cyan. Set up was long but easy, as set up a 2G and 5G connection. High price, but buy cheap buy twice!
customer_reviews.author: Pimpslider

customer_reviews.title: Asus RT-AC86U Router
customer_reviews.text: Great router bought to replace a RT-AC68U and the new one is defiantly quicker. I now have them running in AiMesh configuration and have great Wi Fi coverage throughout my house. Knocked a star off the value as the price dropped in the Black Friday deals after I had already bought it which was a little irritating.
customer_reviews.author: B. BEESLEY

customer_reviews.title: WOW...... What a WIFI Router!
customer_reviews.text: This ASUS router is a rule book changer! it's totally amazing from setup to first use. Using a virgin hub 3 , my speeds were around 25/30mb on a 200mb connection...yep that's right, so painfully slow and Virgin kept fobbing me off, so i purchased one of these routers, wow what a difference, ive gone from 30 to 200+ mb in as little as 20 mins, just perfect! highly recommend plus there's lots of excellent enterprise-grade features.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and reliable router with complete integration over BT Fiber network.
customer_reviews.text: Really good router, it works perfectly across all my wireless devices in 2.4G and 5G frequencies. This router works with BT fiber internet and it can be connected directly to the fiber outlet without the BT Router. It also works with BT TV Box without the need to use the BT router which is amazing. Had an issue with the ports 5 to 8 as they stopped working, but a restart will fix the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sérgio Gaitas

customer_reviews.title: Good solid performance especially with AiMesh features
customer_reviews.text: My second Asus router previous being a rt68u I didn’t set the my new router the rt86u up alone I have them both set up in AiMesh mode signal strength and speed improved around whole house very impressed how this works ...have also flashed Asuswrt-Merlin on both of them a wealth of new features top marks from me
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Frequently dropping internet connection
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router based on all the positive reviews out there. However, I am very disappointed because it frequently drops the internet connection. This makes it not usable as audio/video conferencing and streaming keep getting disrupted and Remote Desktop sessions getting disconnected/reconnected. I have tried various configuration tweaks without any success. Switching back to my existing TP-Link router always makes the problem go away. I have concluded that this router is faulty and will make a request to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Huang

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic router. Easy to setup and WiFi coverage is fantastic. I use it with an EE fiber broadband connection as EE modem has a rubbish WiFi. This router made a such a difference, and all my connected devices don’t lose any speed.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because our Virgin Media hub was aweful. I pay for the 350mb package and the speeds and WiFi range we were getting were very inconsistent and not what I was paying for. This router solved all my problems. I now get a consistent speed and WiFi has greatly improved. I highly recommend this product. 5 *****
customer_reviews.author: Builder the Bob

customer_reviews.title: Space age router!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, connected to our Virgin Super Hub 2 it gives better 5G signal around the house and doesn't drop any of the devices so far, Xbox One and Xbox 360 constantly online gaming, and numerous phones and tablets. So far very happy, 4 weeks in. It is quite big but it's doing a lot, we put it on top of a book case and unless you know it's there you wouldn't notice it!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Garratt

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant device
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant, 4 bedroom detached house. Place in the middle, full signal throughout the house garden and detached garage. Multiple in excess of 20 devices connected. Fantastic QoS and device management with parental controls
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Was really easy to setup and works well. One thing i would say is the power cable is a little short for plugging in areas a long way from a power point.other than that works well and has improved my setup and signal. More reliable than the virgin media hub.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly and  John

customer_reviews.title: Really good fast modem, no drops no problems.
customer_reviews.text: Medium to high user. Lots of computers In the family. 6 people using their pcs at once. All gaming. No drop outs in over a month! Signal strength very good and so many settings compared to BT hubs and such like. Remember to get a separate modem, but this has been the best internet experience I have had - can’t fault this modem.
customer_reviews.author: steven J Need

customer_reviews.title: Superb.
customer_reviews.text: This is a superb machine! I am no IT expert and it took a LITTLE fiddling to set up with the right BT broadband username and password, but I now can actually enjoy using the internet again. It's like discovering broadband for the first time...over again! The thing gets a strong signal at the top of the (tall and difficult for wifi) house, and we are geting wireless download speeds at 8pm that surpass BT's estimates. It's expensive, but it IS good!
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Rention

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: what a machine! so much to do inside of the interface and can customise a lot of stuff inside has a lot more ports and so much safety features, only thing i would say is it is a big bulky machine but does an amazing job
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good router but ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to give a one star as amazon sent me out a broken second hand unit, which had a lot more cosmetic damage than expected. The router had no wan Connectivity and lan ports 1-4 weren’t functioning correctly. Bought a new one today and worked straight away. The router itself is great and the gui appears to be easy to navigate. From what I can tell , there has been improvement to fifa 29 gameplay but I need to really test it.
customer_reviews.author: b n gray

customer_reviews.title: Good kit
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, improved my rubbish Virgin media box . Pity I had to buy it in the first place, Thanks virgin media.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Tried for hours to get the router to work but it had wireless issues and a power fault. Wasted too much time so I have returned the item and will not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a year now and its great. It has a great dashboard with plenty of features and the signal is brilliant across a house in an area with a lot of wifi interference.
customer_reviews.author: Richie

product_meta.title: ASUS RT-AC88U Dual-band (2.4 GHz / 5 GHz) Gigabit Ethernet Black,Red 3G 4G

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars174 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
